algorithm_technique: Iterate up to the square root of the number, summing divisors and their complements, then check if the sum equals twice the number.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a number is a perfect number (sum of its proper divisors equals the number itself).
problem_summary_technical: Calculate the sum of all positive divisors of a number, excluding the number itself, and compare it to the number.
time_complexity: O(sqrt(n)) where n is the input number
key_insights: Divisors come in pairs (i, n/i). Iterating up to sqrt(n) finds all pairs efficiently.
Special handling is needed for perfect squares to avoid double-counting the square root.
The sum of proper divisors is equivalent to checking if the sum of all divisors (including n) equals 2*n.
